title: You are nerfing Aurelion Sol more then buffing him
body:
I have played 700~ games of Aurelion sol in ranked at least and from those games i rarely ever need the extra 10 seconds off my ult rather the 1% nerf on celerity movement speed is in my opinion a more drastic change. This nerf will most likely drop Asol's winrate even harder. One of the reasons why sol is failing in this meta is because phase rush was nothing like stormraiders and Sol can no longer compete with champions like ahri and zed and is out maneuvered easily. 

A easy way to fix these problems would be to buff Phase rush, give it slow resistance and an increased duration to better position ones-self. Another large problem aside from the runes is Aurelion sol, unless fed is a DOT champion and with the burst meta he suffers, an increased Q stun duration or more damage on W would bring Sol back to his former glory.

Sincerely a worried Sol main rito please help my champion.

Edit:Just to show the drastic change of the "Keystone"

_**Phase rush**_
Applying 3 stacks to a target within a 3 second period grants you 15% - 40% (based on level) movement speed for 3 seconds.

_**Stormraider's Surge**_
Dealing 30% of a champion's maximum health within 2.5 seconds grants you 40% bonus movement speed and 75% Slow Resist for 3 seconds.

Huge difference, losing the 75% slow resistance and 25% movement speed dropped his winrate 4% :(.

It's not my bias, it's official competitive statistics of ~0% Juggernaut pick rate throughout the 2017 season (excluding {{champion:31}} for many reasons).

I was more talking about the whole stormraiders being intended for juggernauts and not mages.  Also the part about being glad that {{summoner:6}} isn't melee only.

It's natural for juggernauts to not be viable in the competitive environment with current strategies.  They're intended to be easily kitable which becomes a bigger and bigger weakness as players improve.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AeYfJJAU,comment-id=00010001000100000000,timestamp=2017-11-23T07:29:56.701+0000)

> It's natural for juggernauts to not be viable in the competitive environment with current strategies.  They're intended to be easily kitable which becomes a bigger and bigger weakness as players improve.

Yeah, it's only *natural* since throughout whole Season 6&7 they have been outclassed by tanks, and still are. However it shouldn't be like this, they need to get major buffs or tanks need to get nerfed.

For juggernauts to be viable in a competitive environment, they'd need to be downright oppressive.  Otherwise they can just be kited and/or chain cced until they die.  The only way for juggernauts to survive focused fire is to land their abilities to heal off, and that is generally denied by cc.

How would you make juggernauts competitively viable without being oppressive?

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AeYfJJAU,comment-id=0001000100010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-23T18:42:40.930+0000)

> How would you make juggernauts competitively viable without being oppressive?

[These are some of the ways](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/bAo1nTV0-ways-of-improving-juggernauts-long-post).

1: I agree that tenacity should affect knockups and such, especially considering how prevalent they are.  I do not think that additively stacking tenacity would be balanced though because that would make cc near useless against them (with now way to counteract that like you can stacking armor or mr).

2: Shielding I agree with about not stacking, though there should be a few exceptions such as: Aery stacking with anything and Lux's shield should still stack with itself.

3: Nothing can really be done about the mobility creep now.  Even if they released a bunch of immobile champions, there are already the ones that currently exist.

4: If {{item:3165}} lost its grevious wounds, it would need to be added to another mage item or mages would be left without anything to consistently combat healing.  Best candidate to me would probably be {{item:3285}}, as it could be tied to the passive making it not constant but consistent while also providing an actual niche for the item.

They are planning on working on mage itemization sometime this next season, so you may get your wish there.

5: The only way the meta would shift from being team-fight centered would be if there were a bunch of small objectives that could easily be soloed in a reasonable amount of time.  That would give incentive to split up, but it would also result in more PvE gameplay rather than PvP and would probably start feeling a little silly.  As for putting more focus on top lane, the only way I could see them doing that is with something else in the Baron pit (since everything else on the map is mirrored and would thus exist bot lane as well).

Overall I think your ideas would certainly improve the situation for juggernauts, but not enough to result in them being huge competitive.  Their weaknesses are so glaring that they'd need to be op outside of pro games to be viable in them.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AeYfJJAU,comment-id=000100010001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-11-23T21:58:18.845+0000)
>
> 1: I agree that tenacity should affect knockups and such, especially considering how prevalent they are.  I do not think that additively stacking tenacity would be balanced though because that would make cc near useless against them (with now way to counteract that like you can stacking armor or mr).

I was saying either tenacity should stack additively (and not affect knockups) or multiplicatively (live) but affect all forms of CC. Also 3rd option is to have an item that provides immunity to displacement effects only (knockups, knockbacks, pulls) for X seconds.


> 4: If {{item:3165}} lost its grevious wounds, it would need to be added to another mage item or mages would be left without anything to consistently combat healing.  Best candidate to me would probably be {{item:3285}}, as it could be tied to the passive making it not constant but consistent while also providing an actual niche for the item.

I feel like it's always easiest to carry with mages, therefore I don't feel like they need to have an counter to everything. After all Juggernauts are countered by so many things, no one gives a shit. Also one could always bring {{summoner:14}} while also have his adc/juggernaut have {{item:3123}} and tank {{item:3076}} . Grievous Wounds are wide and plenty, this fact hurts Juggernauts the most.


> 5: The only way the meta would shift from being team-fight centered would be if there were a bunch of small objectives that could easily be soloed in a reasonable amount of time.  That would give incentive to split up, but it would also result in more PvE gameplay rather than PvP and would probably start feeling a little silly.  As for putting more focus on top lane, the only way I could see them doing that is with something else in the Baron pit (since everything else on the map is mirrored and would thus exist bot lane as well).

If there were objectives top other than Rift Herald, it would result in 1v1 of top laners, or 2v2 with jungler or even 3v3 with mages getting involved just like they are on bot. 

> Overall I think your ideas would certainly improve the situation for juggernauts, but not enough to result in them being huge competitive.  Their weaknesses are so glaring that they'd need to be op outside of pro games to be viable in them.

Which is the whole point, you said:

>How would you make juggernauts competitively viable without being oppressive?

If the objectives up top were too valuable, the game would become even more snowbally.  Also there's the possibility that pro teams would just lane swap.

Overall while I think your changes would be an improvement (as I said), I still don't think they'd be enough to make them viable in pro games.

I do like your ideas for tenacity and shields, though I think tenacity working on displacement would be a better fix than making it additive (as that could just invalidate regular cc).
